body:
Hello,

The team I'm on wanted to not have an unauthenticated gRPC endpoint (that has access to change things) in our K8s cluster. We looked into [enabling TLS](https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/securing_installation.md#the-tiller-grpc-endpoint-and-tls), but instead ended up using the Tillerless Helm v2 plugin (https://github.com/rimusz/helm-tiller).

FWIW, our opinion was we found it more desirable / easier (at least for us) to use the plugin, vs creating `*.tls` certs and setting up a pipeline to manage them (to store them, and create new ones when current ones expire - and this would've been especially cumbersome if we setup a [separate TLS certificate](https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/securing_installation.md#best-practices-for-securing-helm-and-tiller) for each endpoint).
Also, whenever helm v3 comes out, the [proposal](https://github.com/helm/community/blob/master/helm-v3/000-helm-v3.md) calls for going tiller-less.

So I'd like to ask if it would make sense to update [securing_installation.md](https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/securing_installation.md) to at least mention the plugin as another (if not the recommended) option (besides enabling TLS) for not having a wide open gRPC endpoint? 
If the answer is yes, I'd be happy to create such a PR to modify `securing_installation.md` - I just wanted to ask first. 
(By the way, currently the only place where this repo mentions the "Tillerless Helm v2" plugin is [docs/related.md](https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/related.md).)

Thanks!
title: Securing Helm documentation: add tillerless plugin
